column1: three-wheeler every day. In addition, although PW-2 stated the order in
which children usually get off the three-wheeler, she had not stated that
every day during the period specified in the charge, all the children were
dropped  off  according  to  the  same  order.  It  is  apparent  that  if  the
appellant wanted to sexually abuse PW-1, he would select an occasion
where   PW-1 was alone in the three-wheeler. PW-1’s evidence was that
happened. Therefore, because of the evidence of PW-2, no improbability
occurs with regard to PW-1’s evidence that on this particular day, when
she was alone in the three-wheeler, the appellant sexually abused her.
